etymology.description: semantic: 疒(疒) (nè, "illness; disease") + phonetic: 沙(沙) (shā, "sand") = conveys the idea of a sand-like rash -> rash; measles
etymology.interpretation: The character 痧(shā, "rash; measles") combines the semantic component 疒(疒) (nè, "illness; disease") with the phonetic 沙(沙) (shā, "sand"). This pairing suggests an illness characterized by rash-like symptoms, akin to the texture of sand.

examples.chinese: 他皮肤上出现痧(他皮膚上出現痧)。
examples.english: A rash appeared on his skin.

examples.chinese: 高温天气时(高溫天氣時)，部分人会得痧(部分人會得痧)。
examples.pinyin: Gāowēn tiānqì shí, bùfèn rén huì dé shā.
examples.english: In hot weather, some people may develop a rash.
